home.title: Let's start with the most important insight

pages.title: The product with the highest emissions is beef. But how much impact does it really have?
What makes a bigger difference?
pages.subtitle: for reducing CO2 in average European or North American diet

answerExplanation.text: Beef has the highest footprint of any meat. Of course, replacing beef with chicken (or pork) is not the end goal of a sustainable diet. But itâ€™s an easy first step that already makes a huge difference. Without eating any less meat, this step alone would reduce the carbon footprint of the average Western diet by one fifth!

pages.subtitle: Todays recipe is a great way to replace beef

home.title: Explore where most food is wasted

pages.title: Before the food ends up on your plate it has travelled through many hands. Food waste can happen anywhere in the supply chain.
In Western countries, most food is wasted...
pages.subtitle: Hier komt een subtitel

answerExplanation.text: ... at home. More than half of all food waste in North America and Europe happens at consumption. That means all of us have a role to play.
